div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 2305 Teboursouk, 100 km. SW of Tunis, (1073) Tunisia, 1903 Burial: 2nd-1st cent. B.C. (Jenkins) Contents: 1000 AE Carthage: Sicilian mint (as SNGCop. 102, 120 overstruck; perhaps also as 94, 107) Sardinian mint (as SNGCop. 144) Numidia (Massinissa and successors): AE (some ctmk.: Ammon hd.), 1 PL Flans Disposition: Tunis (Bardo) some BCTH 1904, p. cxcv Comm. de Bray, Bulletin de la Société archéologique de Sousse 1907, pp. 95-7 (inexact data) AA 1909, p. 204
